results.name: Cloud Run hosting decision
results.answer: The decision was to use Cloud Run for API hosting [N1]. The key reason is that it scales to zero when idle, which keeps costs near zero during development [N1]. The service also auto-scales up to 10 instances under load [N1].

results.name: Chunk size configuration
results.answer: The target chunk size is 450 characters with 75 character overlap for context continuity [N1]. After testing, 450 character chunks with 75 character overlap perform best [N2]. Testing included 200, 400, 600, and 800 character chunks, but 450 had the best retrieval accuracy at 87% [N2].

results.name: Rate limit configuration
results.answer: The API rate limits are 60 requests per minute per tenant for production [N1]. The chat endpoint has a 30 second timeout [N1]. The maximum query length is 2000 characters [N1]. The system uses in-memory rate limiting with a sliding window algorithm [N1].

results.name: Sprint 1 target date
results.answer: The target launch date for the MVP is January 15, 2025 [N2]. Sprint 1 goals include completing the MVP with basic notes CRUD, simple search, and a chat endpoint [N2]. The team consists of 2 backend devs and 1 frontend dev [N2]. The budget is $500/month for cloud costs [N2]. The Q1 2025 roadmap inclu

results.name: TypeScript decision
results.answer: The backend uses TypeScript with Express.js [N1]. TypeScript was chosen over Python Flask due to team familiarity and strong typing [N1]. This decision aimed to provide type safety and a better developer experience [N1]. The application will be hosted on Cloud Run [N2], which scales to zero when idl

results.name: Pricing decision
results.answer: The pricing strategy will be $9.99/month for Pro [N1], and the free tier is limited to 100 notes [N1]. The target users are researchers, students, and writers [N1]. results.name: Architecture summary
results.answer: The architecture uses Cloud Run for API hosting and Firestore for persistence [N1]. The backend uses TypeScript with Express.js, and the frontend uses React with Vite [N2]. Key points: * Cloud Run was chosen for API hosting because it scales to zero when idle and auto-scales up to 10 instances under

results.name: RAG implementation details
results.answer: The retrieval system in the RAG pipeline uses hybrid search combining vector similarity with keyword matching [N1]. The embeddings are 768-dimensional using text-embedding-004 [N1]. Chunks target 450 characters with 75 character overlap for context continuity [N1].

results.name: Competitor comparison
results.answer: Notion AI uses GPT-4 [N1] and costs $10/user/month [N1]. Mem.ai focuses on memory graph [N1] and costs $15/month [N1]. Obsidian Copilot is local-first [N1] and has a one-time cost of $50 [N1]. Our advantage is simplicity and citation transparency [N1][N5]. We chose Vertex AI text-embedding-004 for q

results.name: Risk and mitigation
results.answer: The main risks are API cost overruns, user adoption, and competition from established players like Notion AI [N1].
